column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Drive Your Car on to a Ferry
#Text=If you 're visiting an island , you may suddenly have to pick up a new driving skill : getting your vehicle onto a car ferry .
#Text=Luckily , it 's easier than it looks , and minimal preparation is required to make sure you have an easy trip .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Purchase a ticket .
#Text=It is sometimes possible to purchase tickets online .
#Text=If the ferry company you are traveling with does not allow this , you will have to purchase your ticket at the terminal .
#Text=Ticket booths will be available .
#Text=Different booths will sell tickets to different destinations so be sure to read the signs carefully .
#Text=Enter the correct lane .
#Text=The line-up will consist of many different lanes .
#Text=Your ticket will tell you which lane you are to go into .
#Text=After choosing the correct one , park as close as possible to the vehicle in front of you .
#Text=Turn off the engine .
#Text=The wait will be a while and it is not good to continue to release harmful emissions into the environment .
#Text=Start your vehicle when you notice your lane beginning to move .
#Text=Follow the vehicles ahead of you onto the ferry .
#Text=You may need to make a variety of complex and tight turns onto various ramps and overpasses .
#Text=There have been incidents where the ramp leading onto the ferry has collapsed with vehicles on it , dropping them into the water .
#Text=For this reason , it is important to perform a variety of different procedures to be able to escape quickly from your vehicle should it fall off of the ramp .
#Text=a ) Open all windows as far as possible .
#Text=Ensure that objects do not blow out .
#Text=The water pressure will be too strong to open your windows under water .
#Text=( Although power windows will continue to operate when submerged , the water pressure will be too great for them to function ) .
#Text=b ) Release all seat belts .

#Text=Although you should wear your seat belt at all times while riding in a moving vehicle , make sure you are not wearing it now as it may take precious seconds to release it should your vehicle fall into the water .
#Text=Ignore the seat belt warning if it begins to beep .
#Text=c ) Make sure all doors are unlocked .
#Text=If the doors of your vehicle lock automatically when you place it in Drive , override this function by pressing the unlock button on the driver 's door .
#Text=Begin to drive onto the ferry .
#Text=Make sure step 5 is completed before reaching the final ramp ( the one bridging the ferry and the terminal ) .
#Text=Continue to follow the direction of the terminal staff .
#Text=As you enter the ferry , continue to follow the direction of the crew .
#Text=The crew will direct you to a parking spot .
#Text=It is essential that you follow their directions as it is their job to ensure that the weight of all vehicles are distributed evenly throughout the ship .
#Text=Otherwise , the boat could tip over .
#Text=Once you have been directed to your final parking spot , park your vehicle within twenty four centimeters of the vehicle in front of you .
#Text=This will maximize the number of vehicles that can be fit on the ferry .
#Text=Place your vehicle in Park after engaging the parking brake .
#Text=Lock your vehicle , but do not activate the alarm .
#Text=If the crossing gets a bit bumpy , the movement may set off your car alarm , and lead to nuisance and potential embarrassment .
#Text=When it is time to disembark , do not start your engine until the other vehicles in your lane begin to move .
#Text=This will reduce the amount of emissions in the ferry .
#Text=Video
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not talk or text message on your cell phone while driving onto the ferry .
#Text=Driving onto a ferry requires concentration and one false move could cause an accident .
